Html:
Hello,

I'm trying to redefine rules for Flash Plugin deployments - as of today I use the predefined 'installable' rule & add a 'WindowsVersion' rule to define the 'ProductType'. This works without a hassle but: the update shows as needed even on machines where e.g. Firefox is not installed.

Now I've tried to to add a 'FileExists' rule with the only parameter "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" - pressing 'Publish' crashes WPP. This happens , too, if I revise an existing Package & try to modify the rule ...

Can't see my error, any help appreciated ;)

Regards
Joerg

Hi,
start WPP, do exactly the same things. After crash, go to %temp% and find the file Wpp-GUID.log. Send it to me at package.publisher@free.fr

Hi, thank you for the debug file.
When you have add the 'File Exists' rule, do you have put the filepath between quotes : " C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe "
If yes, remove it. Wpp will take care of spaces in the path.

... strange - but great: removing the double quotes from the path did the trick - update successfully revised & 12.0.0.44 published. I've really overlooked the double double quotes in my attempts. Perhaps this should be mentioned anywhere in help/explanation window ...

Thankx & regards
Joerg
